intro: [WRONG START] Anthemis diffusa, commonly known as field chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers and aromatic, feathery leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas such as meadows and grasslands. It is known for its medicinal properties, particularly its use in traditional herbal remedies. The leaves and flowers are often used to make teas and are valued for their calming and anti-inflammatory effects.
